meanings.definition: A person who frustrates or ruins a plan or undertaking.
meanings.sent1: The marplot accidentally revealed the surprise party to the birthday girl.
meanings.sent2: The meddling marplot caused chaos by giving out incorrect directions.
meanings.sent3: The well-meaning marplot thought he was helping, but ended up causing more harm than good.
meanings.sent4: The gossiping neighbor acted as a marplot, spreading rumors that led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy marplot tripped over the power cord, shutting down the presentation abruptly.

meanings.definition: To interfere with or thwart a plan or undertaking.
meanings.sent1: Please don't marplot our efforts to organize the event smoothly.
meanings.sent2: His impulsive decision to change the schedule completely marplotted our carefully laid out plans.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed determined to marplot the picnic by stealing all the snacks.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rainstorm marplotted our outdoor concert, forcing us to move indoors.
meanings.sent5: Her sudden outburst marplotted the meeting, causing confusion among the attendees.
